comm_body: Hello Shardul,  Thank you for contacting AWS Support. It was nice working with you today.  To summarize, you were looking to understand the reason of your EMR cluster master node: i-0a237432abe5dfaf2 failing its status checks and becoming unreachable earlier today, as you mentioned that this has happened previously too.   During our chat session, I reviewed the instance and noticed its failed its instance status check between 13:00 and 13:50 UTC. [1] This instance level status check typically indicates an issue with the instance's operating system, like file system level issues, resource contention / over utilization (disk i/o, memory, cpu).   Next, I checked the console logs available to me, and found multiple counts of "out of memory" errors. I requested you to check those yourself by going to the EC2 console > Selecting the instance > Actions > Monitor and Troubleshoot > Get System Log. These "out of memory" errors show that the operating system ran out of memory, and therefore the kernel killed processes through "oom-killer". To learn more about this, please see [2]. We also looked at the "mem_used_percent" CloudWatch custome metric [3] being published from the instance, and saw a spike in memory utilization reaching almost 100%.   Further, I looked at the EBS volumes attached to the instance, and observed high disk I/O on vol-0337f1c4bd6d928db. There was an increase in the VolumeReadOps [4] around the incident time frame, and this volume used / depleted all of its burst credits as well. [5] This means that there was high disk activity on the instance, and this volume was pushing more than its baseline performance of 300 IOPS thus using its burst credits. Once the burst balance depletes, the performance of the volume is reduced to its baseline performance, so if the workload/application running at the OS end still continues to push more IOPS than this could make the instance unreachable. You can learn more about I/O credits and Burst Balance at [6].  In short summary, it appears the instance became unreachab

comm_body: Hello Shammi,  Thank you for your time on chat and screen-share session today. This is Sarvani and I am writing this email to summarize our conversation.  You have reached out to us as you are getting dependency issues when running the command 'apt install build-essential' and need assistance to fix the same.  During our chat, I confirmed that I am able to install build-essential package on my test ec2 instance launched from the same AMI as yours without any issues. On screen-share session, we took a backup of the instance by creating an AMI(ami-0900224b111702915). Then, we ran the same commands again and noticed that the package has dependencies on libc6-dev, gcc and g++ versions.  We tried to install these packages and could not install them on your instance. Also, we ran the following command to move the file in "/etc/apt/sources.list.d/" to different file name as here:   # mv google-chrome.list.save.1 1.google-chrome.list.save  Even after making these changes, we are unable to update the libc6-dev and install build-essential packages. Thus, I did some research and found some third-party articles, which might be helpful in resolving this issue:  [+] https://askubuntu.com/questions/937254/cannot-install-build-essential-gcc-g-after-upgrade-to-17-04  [+] https://serverfault.com/questions/993576/debian-apt-install-build-essential-fails-because-of-unmet-dependencies  Since, these are third-party articles, AWS cannot guarantee the integrity of the same. Thus, I would recommend you to test these in your test machine before applying to the production environment. Also, as your instance have custom configurations in "/etc/apt/sources.list.d/", I have recommended you to involve your System Administrator to test the steps outlined above as they will have better understanding of your setup. Also package installation is a System admin task and falls out of scope of AWS Support[1]. However, I tried to help you on a best-effort basis to resolve this issue.   I hope this information is of assistance. Should you have any furt

comm_body: Hi Sundar,  Greetings for the day!  Thanks for your time over the chat today and it was a pleasure to having conversation with you.  To summarize the conversation, you contacted us regarding the IIS website issue and while performing the load tests you are getting the error code 504 (gateway time out).  ELB - trs-uat-in-alb Targets - i-0fd08ff7af2e7ad78, i-07d6299ac53708c55  With reference to the below article, this 504 error code indicates that issue with the targets.  [+] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/load-balancer-troubleshooting.html#http-504-issues  Over the screen sharing session, we have followed the below troubleshooting steps to isolate the issue.  # Initially, I found that i-0fd08ff7af2e7ad78 was reported as unhealthy in ELB but after sometime it was returned to healthy state. # Performed the application load tests and got the same 504 errors. # This time i-07d6299ac53708c55 was reported as unhealthy. RDP the instance and tried browsing the website locally but it was not working. Restarted the website from IIS console then instance was healthy. #  Performed the application load tests again and then got the same issue on i-0fd08ff7af2e7ad78.  Conclusion ---------------------  With respect to the ELB and EC2 side, I did not find any issues however, the issue seems to be related to website code or IIS service (due to the load website is getting hung or not responding to the requests and its causing the 504 errors). Further, your application team is going to review the code and investigate the issue.  Based on your confirmation, I am resolving this case but please feel free to contact us if you need any assistance. We will be glad to assist you. Thank you.  We value your feedback. comm_body: Hi Satya,  Thank you for contacting AWS Premium Support. It was a pleasure to speak with you today.  To recap you had contacted us as you observed you were unable to launch more than 1000 EC2 instances. I assisted you in a screen sharing session.  Example instance :  i-0d1a214a8b5b8cb55 - Observed instance was launched and terminated approximately in 3mins - Instance was terminated by Autoscaling group  - From CloudTrail while searching with the resource i-0d1a214a8b5b8cb55 observed RegisterTargets API failed with error message "The maximum number of targets on target group 'arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:us-east-1:661678605921:targetgroup/ATVTr-ALBTa-OLR6C9FNTV1J/7af43af6787f5c8b' has been reached", - This message clearly indicated that you are hitting ELB service quota Targets per Application Load Balancer and since instance couldn't be added as target to the ELB, ASG terminated the instance.  - Using [2] confirmed your ELB service quota Targets per Application Load Balancer is at the default value of 1000 which explains the issue that you observed. - For additional information on the ELB service quota please see [3] - To increase the respective quota please follow [4]  I trust the information shared was useful to you.As discussed I am proceeding to mark this case as resolved.Please feel free to open a new support request if you need any further assistance from AWS Support.  Reference :  [1] CloudTrail - RegisterTargets Error : TooManyTargetsException https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/home?region=us-east-1#/events?StartTime=2021-08-17T22:40:28.000Z&EndTime=2021-08-17T22:45:28.000Z&ResourceName=i-0d1a214a8b5b8cb55  [2] Service Quotas console https://console.aws.amazon.com/servicequotas/home  [3] Elastic Load Balancing endpoints and quotas?https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/elb.html  [4] Requesting a quota increase https://docs.aws.amazon.com/servicequotas/latest/userguide/request-quota-increase.html  We value your feedback. comm_body: Hello Darshan,  Thank you for writing back to you and i am sorry for not getting back to you sooner as i was on a weekoff for last 2 days.  From your recent correspondence, i understand that adding a iptable rule has note resolved the connection issue. So now in order to have more insights on the connection issue, i would request you to provide us the following information to troubleshoot the issue further.  Required information :  1. Open two different ssh sessions for both source (windows instance) and destination (linux instance)  - From source initiate a telnet (i.e. $telnet 172.30.63.121 8090) from the source server and then immediately on the destination server run the command : $ tcpdump -w destination.pcap -i eth0  port 8090  Note :  Once the telnet connection shows the failure message, please initiate the same telnet command for atleast 3-5 times and let the TCPdump capture those packet traffic information.  - Likewise open 2 different ssh sessions of source server (i.e. windows), and on one session initiate a telnet command (i.e. $telnet 172.30.63.121 8090) and then immediately on 2nd session of source server run the following command to capture the tcpdump : $ tcpdump -w source.pcap -i eth0   2. Run the traceroute command on windows instance (source)  $ tcptraceroute 172.30.63.121 8090  3. Run the traceroute command on linux instance (destination)  $ traceroute 172.30.62.121   3. Capture a MTR report on your source server (windows). For more detailed information on how to capture a MTR report in windows, please see : https://help.akliz.net/docs/use-ping-traceroute-and-mtr    - Likewise also capture a bidirectional MTR report from destination (Linux server).  On linux (  run "$ mtr 172.30.62.121"  and leave it running for at least 30 seconds. Press s to pause the data collection.  4. comm_body: Hello Raghav,  Thank you for contacting AWS Premium Support. Phumlani again, please see below a summary of our chat.  You reached out to us because your Ec2 windows server  i-040b4a60922286251 failed instance status checks. This happened after modifying the root volume and making changes within the OS to reflect the newly modified size.  We went on a chime call to troubleshoot this issue, and we did the following to resolve the issue.   1. We used a helper instance to attach the affected root volume.  2. From disk management I noticed that there are two partitions, we made the D: partition active.  3. We also executed Ec2Rescue[1] tool to restore from last known good configuration.  4. Detached the volume and attached  it to the original server  i-040b4a60922286251.  The server started successfully and passed both instance and system status checks.  Once again I would like to thank you for your patience while we have been working on this case over the chime call.   Additionally, the security group of your instances allows incoming traffic to TCP port 3389 from Anywhere. This leaves your instance vulnerable to attacks. In particular, this Windows vulnerability attack directed at RDP port (TCP 3389). Therefore, I recommend that you immediately lock down the port(s) by editing your security group rules to only allow traffic from specific sources, i.e., the IP or CIDR blocks of your client.[2]  As agreed on chat I will go ahead and resolve the case, If you have any other concerns please feel free to open a case with us we will be more than happy to assist you further.  Have a great day!   References: [1] Use EC2Rescue for Windows Server GUI - Analyze an offline instance - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/WindowsGuide/ec2rw-gui.html#ec2rescue-offline [2] Security groups for your VPC - Update security group rules - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_SecurityGroups.html#updating-security-group-rules  We value your feedback. comm_body: Hello Pranit,  Thanks for your time over the chat today, I just wanted to send a follow-up email recapping our conversation. You initiated the chat as you wanted to know how to create an AMI of domain joined production instance (i-0df0c495603b77908).   As discussed, for domain joined Windows instances it is recommended to perform a sysprep using EC2config (for Windows 2012 R2 or lower) and EC2launch (for windows 2016 or above). This is done because all the Windows machines have their own SID which should be unique and if you do not perform a sysprep before creating an image then all the instance deployed using that AMI will have the same SID and machine name which will cause issues for the domain joined machines. Please refer to Microsoft articles [1] & [2] for more information on what sysprep does. Please refer to the article [3] for detailed steps on how to create an AMI for Windows EC2 instances.   Further, please find the procedure to create an AMI for windows 2016 production EC2 instance:  1) Create an AMI of existing production instance [4].  2) Launch a new instance using the AMI created in step 1 in an isolated subnet (no access to other subnets or Microsoft AD).  3) Perform a sysprep on the instance created in step 2 using the reference link [5].  4) Create a new AMI using the syspreped EC2 instance.  5) Now you can use this AMI to deploy further production instances and join them to the domain.   Please note you will need local administrator credentials of production instance in order to login to the helper instance created in Step 2. If you do not have local administrator credentials then I would suggest you to create a new local user on production instance and add it to local administrators group before creating an AMI from it in step 1.  I trust I was able to answer all your queries related to the case. Please let me know if you have any further queries/concerns regarding this case and I would be happy to assist.  Stay safe and have a splendid day further!  Reference Links: =============== [1] Micro

comm_body: Hello,  Thank you for reaching out to AWS support my name is Peter and this is a recap from our chat.  You wanted to find out why there was no connectivity between your two instances after a recent Security Group update.  During my investigation i checked the instances Security Groups and found out that there was no outbound ports allowing for the source instance to communicate with the destination instance. No out bound  meant that the source system wasn't able to establish any connection with the destination instance.  I tested this out in my environment by creating two instances and modifying Security Group to only allow outbound to specific ports to my second instance. Once I had the port opened I used netcat to open the port on the destination instance and used telnet on the source instance to test communication.  You were able to update your Security Group rules to allow TCP port ranges to the destination hosts CIDR range and you tested the connection with telnet and connection had resumed. You mentioned the changes were from an old security group that was working and you had simply reverted to them.  TCP 0 - 65535 10.114.0.0/16 test, should be removed  This rule was the one that allowed traffic to flow from the source to destination. You can modify this rule to only include the specific ports you need open .  For security group rules, you have to remember to open needed ports, if you are only allowing specific ports outbound, you must allow for each port or port range if you intend for communication with other instances[1].  At the end of the chat you were able to confirm everything works and you mentioned it was okay to close this case. If you have any questions please feel free to update us here or start a call or chat to get connected with an engineer to assist you live.   =======References===== [1]https://docs.aws.amazon.com/quicksight/latest/user/vpc-security-groups.html  We value your feedback. Please share your experience by rating this correspondence using the AWS Support Center link at the end of

comm_body: Hello Vamsi,  Greeting for the day!  My name is Bharath, and I am just following up with a short summary of our chat today. You contacted us because you were unable to send mail from your EC2 instance.   Upon initial investigation, I confirmed that all the configuration from the instance looked good and there was no blockage from the AWS side.   After that we joined a screenshare session to understand your setup, we then analyzed the postfix server and found that there was an issue with the configuration. Therefore, we removed postfix and then reinstalled it.   Once we installed it, we configured it using this [1] guide. We were able to successfully send an email after configuring it.   As discussed on chat, I will be closing this case since this is not related to AWS.   Should you have additional questions or concerns, please get back to us, and we will be happy to assist you.  References: [1] https://www.howtoforge.com/tutorial/configure-postfix-to-use-gmail-as-a-mail-relay/  We value your feedback. Please share your experience by rating this correspondence using the AWS Support Center link at the end of this correspondence. Each correspondence can also be rated by selecting the stars in top right corner of each correspondence within the AWS Support Center.  Best regards, Bharath R. comm_body: Hello Paramjeet,  Shivakumar here from AWS Support, Sydney. It was pleasure chatting with you today.   To summarize, you reached out to us as one of the instance got terminated automatically from the ASG and would like to know the root cause.   EC2 has detected underlying hardware issue on the affected instance few days ago and it got terminated due to scheduled retirement after 2021-08-22 04:00:00 UTC. A PHD notification was sent on 08-Aug-2021 regarding this scheduled retirement with the following message.  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ EC2 has detected degradation of the underlying hardware hosting your Amazon EC2 instance associated with this event in the us-east-1 region. Due to this degradation your instance could already be unreachable. We will stop your instance after 2021-08-22 04:00:00 UTC. Please take appropriate action before this time. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Upon reviewing your PHD, I also noticed another open issue like "EC2 AutoScaling launch template not found". I suggested you to review and take appropriate action.   I hope I was able to answer your questions today. As discussed, I am closing this case as there is no further required from AWS side. Feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions.   Stay safe and have a great day ahead !  We value your feedback. Please share your experience by rating this correspondence using the AWS Support Center link at the end of this correspondence. Each correspondence can also be rated by selecting the stars in top right corner of each correspondence within the AWS Support Center.  Best regards, Shivakumar B. comm_body: Hello Team,  We have implemented SQL Always on cluster based on AWS advised procedures as per doc.  https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-windows-sql-server-always-on-cluster/  Details of cluster below.  App Servers 10.103.29.230 10.103.25.255  DB instances Name: WA1ELIXIRDBP001.myl.com Address: 10.103.37.69 Name: WA1ELIXIRDBP002.myl.com Address: 10.103.38.236 Name:    Wa1sqlclst001.myl.com ( Windows Cluster) Address:  10.103.37.165  SQL Listener AG-ELIXIRP001.myl.com  Primary: WA1ELIXIRDBP002\ELIXIRDBP     IP 10.103.37.132 Secondary: WA1ELIXIRDBP001\ELIXIRDBP   IP 10.103.38.24  When the SQL Primary server is active from SQL end, App servers reach to  primary sql  listener IP which  10.103.37.132 and are able to connect successfully.   But if the Application server tries to connect to secondary listener IP 10.103.38.24 which is offline and will be active only if SQL fails over to secondary node there is a failure.  Although this is the default behavior, Since both primary and secondary listener IP's are on DNS, when App server tries to resolve to the inactive Sql listener , application fails.  Is there a resolution for this issue. Please advise.  thanks Sai Instance ID(s): i-0df6368303533b289 Volume ID(s):  Timestamp (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS UTC):

comm_body: Step 1: Make sure the machine is not using any proxy echo "$http_proxy" echo "$https_proxy"  No Proxy  Step 2: Confirm the architecture $ python -c 'import yum, pprint; yb = yum.YumBase(); pprint.pprint(yb.conf.yumvar, width=1)' It should match with URL configuration for "https://rhui3.ap-south-1.aws.ce.redhat.com/pulp/repos/content/dist/rhel/rhui/server/7/7/x86_64/rh-common/os/repodata/repomd.xml "  Ouput: {'arch': 'ia32e',  'basearch': 'x86_64',  'infra': 'ec2',  'releasever': '7Server',  'uuid': 'd7a2ecc5-bd0a-409b-8576-8ec6642b6057'}   Step 3: Try cleaning the local client cache $ rm -fr /var/cache/yum/* $ yum clean all   I tried this already, and now , Din't work this time also  Step 4: Confirm the billing code $ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/dynamic/instance-identity/document  2>/dev/null | grep billingProducts   "billingProducts" : [ "bp-6fa54006" ],  Ouput:   "billingProducts" : [ "bp-6fa54006" ],  Step 5: From the yum output, it looks like rhui-lb plugin is not loaded. Please provide the following output: $  ls -al /etc/yum.repos.d Outpu: -rw-r--r--.  1 root root  1050 Sep 17  2019 epel.repo -rw-r--r--.  1 root root  1149 Sep 17  2019 epel-testing.repo -rw-r--r--.  1 root root   358 Sep 25 14:17 redhat.repo -rw-r--r--.  1 root root  4745 Aug 11 09:35 redhat-rhui-beta.repo.disabled -rw-r--r--.  1 root root   504 Sep 24 13:24 redhat-rhui-client-config.repo -rw-r--r--.  1 root root 10218 Sep 25 15:02 redhat-rhui.repo  Step 6: RHUI client is installed  $ rpm -q rh-amazon-rhui-client rh-amazon-rhui-client-2.2.118-1.el7.noarch  Output : rh-amazon-rhui-client-3.0.32-1.el7.noarch  Step 7: Curl the URLs manually to confirm the URL is reachable: $ curl -Iv https://rhui3.ap-south-1.aws.ce.redhat.com/pulp/repos/content/dist/rhel/rhui/server/7/7/x86_64/rh-common/os/repodata/repomd.xml  Output: Its reachable but throws security error  NSS error -8179 (SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER) * Peer's Certificate issuer is not recognized.   Step 8: If none of the above helps, please let me know when was the issue started? Was t

comm_body: Hi there,  We know we can throttle and later we can again call describe address api. But our use case doesn't allow to delay EIP association.  We can explain our use case in details then you can provide better solution.  We have auto-scaling group, during scaling event whenever new instance launch successful then we want to assign with an elastic ip which we already created with some tag "xyz"(500 EIP with same tag). We can't delay in assigning EIP to instance. We are using aws lambda to assign EIP to newer launched instance.   We are calling describe address using tag"xyz" to get all eips then we are filtering available address and then call associate_address api.  If you don't want to increase describe address api limit then you can provide some alternative according to our usecase. This is production issue so you should provide solution quickly.
